issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Wahram V on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with two mural element, in the middle a crescent on a pearl; covered korymbos; pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing below ball of hair, pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running from the shoulders to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. mzdysn bgy wlhl'n MRKAn MRKA 'nyr'n W 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Wāhram šāhān šāh  Ērān ud kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Wahram, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seeds/splendour is from the gods", barbarized
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; on the shaft l’st (rāst, “just”), to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; in front of them bust with stylized crown of Wahram V to the right; alter flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Wahram V, holding a barsom with both hands, dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l.i. wlhl'n| Wāhram| Wahram; barbarized
issue_references_s: SNS 3 AY Type Ib1/1, Var.1  no.24: 230
